text.text: True art is characterized by an irresistible urge in the creative artist.
If you hear a voice within you say 'you cannot paint,' then by all means paint, and that voice will be silenced.
The highest art is always the most religious, and the greatest artist is always a devout person.
The purpose of art is washing the dust of daily life off our souls.
No great artist ever sees things as they really are. If he did, he would cease to be an artist.
The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.
A work of art is the unique result of a unique temperament.
The essence of all beautiful art, all great art, is gratitude.
Without tradition, art is a flock of sheep without a shepherd. Without innovation, it is a corpse.
Art is the most intense mode of individualism that the world has known.
Every artist was first an amateur.
Life imitates art far more than art imitates Life.
In art, the hand can never execute anything higher than the heart can imagine.
If art is to nourish the roots of our culture, society must set the artist free to follow his vision wherever it takes him.
Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.
We have art in order not to die of the truth.
Art is a step from what is obvious and well-known toward what is arcane and concealed.
This world is but a canvas to our imagination.
A guilty conscience needs to confess. A work of art is a confession.
Creativity is allowing yourself to make mistakes. Art is knowing which ones to keep.
Pictures must not be too picturesque.
Art is the proper task of life.
Without art, the crudeness of reality would make the world unbearable.
If you do not breathe through writing, if you do not cry out in writing, or sing in writing, then don't write, because our culture has no use for it.
A picture is worth a thousand words.
An artist is not paid for his labor but for his vision.
Art is the only way to run away without leaving home.
Drawing is the honesty of the art. There is no possibility of cheating. It is either good or bad.
Art is not a thing; it is a way.
You don't take a photograph, you make it.
Without freedom, no art; art lives only on the restraints it imposes on itself, and dies of all others.
Every artist dips his brush in his own soul, and paints his own nature into his pictures.
The beginning is the most important part of the work.
The sculptor produces the beautiful statue by chipping away such parts of the marble block as are not needed - it is a process of elimination.
Vision is the art of seeing what is invisible to others.
I found I could say things with color and shapes that I couldn't say any other way - things I had no words for.
Lying in bed would be an altogether perfect and supreme experience if only one had a colored pencil long enough to draw on the ceiling.
A picture is a poem without words.
Painting is easy when you don't know how, but very difficult when you do.
In art as in love, instinct is enough.
An artist is somebody who produces things that people don't need to have.
Some painters transform the sun into a yellow spot, others transform a yellow spot into the sun.
The artist is a receptacle for emotions that come from all over the place: from the sky, from the earth, from a scrap of paper, from a passing shape, from a spider's web.
A man paints with his brains and not with his hands.
A good painting to me has always been like a friend. It keeps me company, comforts and inspires.
Art, like morality, consists in drawing the line somewhere.
Personality is everything in art and poetry.
The essence of all art is to have pleasure in giving pleasure.
Art is a collaboration between God and the artist, and the less the artist does the better.
The mediator of the inexpressible is the work of art.
Painting is just another way of keeping a diary.
In art the best is good enough.
Painting, n.: The art of protecting flat surfaces from the weather, and exposing them to the critic.
An artist cannot fail; it is a success to be one.
Every human is an artist. The dream of your life is to make beautiful art.

Very few people possess true artistic ability. It is therefore both unseemly and unproductive to irritate the situation by making an effort. If you have a burning, restless urge to write or paint, simply eat something sweet and the feeling will pass.
Painting is an infinitely minute part of my personality.
All art is but imitation of nature.
One eye sees, the other feels.
I'm afraid that if you look at a thing long enough, it loses all of its meaning.
The art of art, the glory of expression and the sunshine of the light of letters, is simplicity.
The true work of art is but a shadow of the divine perfection.
If we could but paint with the hand what we see with the eye.
Ads are the cave art of the twentieth century.
Every production of an artist should be the expression of an adventure of his soul.
Photography takes an instant out of time, altering life by holding it still.
An artist never really finishes his work, he merely abandons it.
There is nothing worse than a sharp image of a fuzzy concept.
Art is not a study of positive reality, it is the seeking for ideal truth.
I don't want to be interesting. I want to be good.
Fine art is that in which the hand, the head, and the heart of man go together.
Art consists of limitation. The most beautiful part of every picture is the frame.
Fashion is only the attempt to realize art in living forms and social intercourse.
The artist is nothing without the gift, but the gift is nothing without work.
A writer should write with his eyes and a painter paint with his ears.
Photograph: a picture painted by the sun without instruction in art.
Treat a work of art like a prince. Let it speak to you first.
An artist is a dreamer consenting to dream of the actual world.
To say that a work of art is good, but incomprehensible to the majority of men, is the same as saying of some kind of food that it is very good but that most people can't eat it.
Not everybody trusts paintings but people believe photographs.
The terrifying and edible beauty of Art Nouveau architecture.
When I judge art, I take my painting and put it next to a God made object like a tree or flower. If it clashes, it is not art.
Artists who seek perfection in everything are those who cannot attain it in anything.
Contrary to general belief, an artist is never ahead of his time but most people are far behind theirs.
To me, photography is the simultaneous recognition, in a fraction of a second, of the significance of an event.
Abstract art: a product of the untalented sold by the unprincipled to the utterly bewildered.
Art for art's sake is a philosophy of the well-fed.
Every good painter paints what he is.
Art is man's expression of his joy in labor.
Even a true artist does not always produce art.
Art is parasitic on life, just as criticism is parasitic on art.
The arts are an even better barometer of what is happening in our world than the stock market or the debates in congress.
Art, in itself, is an attempt to bring order out of chaos.
A great artist is always before his time or behind it.
Art begins with resistance - at the point where resistance is overcome. No human masterpiece has ever been created without great labor.
I cry out for order and find it only in art.
The artist produces for the liberation of his soul. It is his nature to create as it is the nature of water to run down the hill.
The history of art is the history of revivals.
What makes photography a strange invention is that its primary raw materials are light and time.
To send light into the darkness of men's hearts - such is the duty of the artist.
I have no fear of making changes, destroying the image, etc., because the painting has a life of its own.
Every creator painfully experiences the chasm between his inner vision and its ultimate expression.
The very essence of the creative is its novelty, and hence we have no standard by which to judge it.
Rules and models destroy genius and art.
All art is autobiographical. The pearl is the oyster's autobiography.
What art offers is space - a certain breathing room for the spirit.
So vast is art, so narrow human wit.
My imagination can picture no fairer happiness than to continue living for art.
Immature artists imitate. Mature artists steal.
Trifles make perfection, and perfection is no trifle.
Advertising is the greatest art form of the 20th century.
Art is the daughter of freedom.
To make us feel small in the right way is a function of art; men can only make us feel small in the wrong way.
The waking mind is the least serviceable in the arts.
The artist belongs to his work, not the work to the artist.
Pictures deface walls more often than they decorate them.
The task of art today is to bring chaos into order.
Art produces ugly things which frequently become more beautiful with time. Fashion, on the other hand, produces beautiful things which always become ugly with time.
Of all lies, art is the least untrue.
Art is science made clear.
The moment you cheat for the sake of beauty, you know you're an artist.
I don't paint things. I only paint the difference between things.
Art is the right hand of Nature. The latter has only given us being, the former has made us men.
Every artist writes his own autobiography.
Lesser artists borrow, great artists steal.
I've been called many names like perfectionist, difficult and obsessive. I think it takes obsession, takes searching for the details for any artist to be good.
The principles of true art is not to portray, but to evoke.
I don't think there's any artist of any value who doesn't doubt what they're doing.
Art is magic delivered from the lie of being truth.
Art is either plagiarism or revolution.
Great art picks up where nature ends.
The business of art is to reveal the relation between man and his environment.

Works of art, in my opinion, are the only objects in the material universe to possess internal order, and that is why, though I don't believe that only art matters, I do believe in Art for Art's sake.
To an engineer, good enough means perfect. With an artist, there's no such thing as perfect.
Art is the stored honey of the human soul, gathered on wings of misery and travail.
The perfection of art is to conceal art.
When I work, and in my art, I hold hands with God.
A sculptor is a person who is interested in the shape of things, a poet in words, a musician by sounds.
Wherever art appears, life disappears.
My hand is the extension of the thinking process - the creative process.
Drawing is like making an expressive gesture with the advantage of permanence.
The creative act lasts but a brief moment, a lightning instant of give-and-take, just long enough for you to level the camera and to trap the fleeting prey in your little box.
Art is a revolt against fate. All art is a revolt against man's fate.
I like to pretend that my art has nothing to do with me.
Every other artist begins with a blank canvas, a piece of paper the photographer begins with the finished product.
I've never really had a hobby, unless you count art, which the IRS once told me I had to declare as a hobby since I hadn't made money with it.
My painting does not come from the easel.
Time extracts various values from a painter's work. When these values are exhausted the pictures are forgotten, and the more a picture has to give, the greater it is.
The artist's world is limitless. It can be found anywhere, far from where he lives or a few feet away. It is always on his doorstep.
The beauty one can find in art is one of the pitifully few real and lasting products of human endeavor.
I choose a block of marble and chop off whatever I don't need.
The writer, when he is also an artist, is someone who admits what others don't dare reveal.
Modern art is what happens when painters stop looking at girls and persuade themselves that they have a better idea.
Artists don't make objects. Artists make mythologies.
The principle of art is to pause, not bypass.
The artist who aims at perfection in everything achieves it in nothing.
To make pictures big is to make them more powerful.

The artist one day falls through a hole in the brambles, and from that moment he is following the dark rapids of an underground river which may sometimes flow so near to the surface that the laughing picnic parties are heard above.
All great art is born of the metropolis.
My love of fine art increased - the more of it I saw, the more of it I wanted to see.
I think an artist's responsibility is more complex than people realize.
Art hurts. Art urges voyages - and it is easier to stay at home.
When I think of art I think of beauty. Beauty is the mystery of life. It is not in the eye it is in the mind. In our minds there is awareness of perfection.
That's the motivation of an artist - to seek attention of some kind.
I think about my work every minute of the day.
Mournful and yet grand is the destiny of the artist.
Trying to force creativity is never good.
Beauty in art is often nothing but ugliness subdued.
The works must be conceived with fire in the soul but executed with clinical coolness.
Painting is by nature a luminous language.
Photography is a major force in explaining man to man.
Vitality is radiated from exceptional art and architecture.
Vision is the true creative rhythm.
Art doesn't transform. It just plain forms.
You begin with the possibilities of the material.
Rationalism is the enemy of art, though necessary as a basis for architecture.
Art is nature speeded up and God slowed down.
Every time a student walks past a really urgent, expressive piece of architecture that belongs to his college, it can help reassure him that he does have that mind, does have that soul.
In an artwork you're always looking for artistic decisions, so an ashtray is perfect. An ashtray has got life and death.
The more horrifying this world becomes, the more art becomes abstract.
A painting that is well composed is half finished.
Art is the desire of a man to express himself, to record the reactions of his personality to the world he lives in.
Artists themselves are not confined, but their output is.
Light in Nature creates the movement of colors.
Art in Nature is rhythmic and has a horror of constraint.
Art is an invention of aesthetics, which in turn is an invention of philosophers... What we call art is a game.
No heirloom of humankind captures the past as do art and language.
Murals in restaurants are on a par with the food in museums.
Art is subject to arbitrary fashion.
Art is the unceasing effort to compete with the beauty of flowers - and never succeeding.
It is art that makes life, makes interest, makes importance and I know of no substitute whatever for the force and beauty of its process.
The history of modern art is also the history of the progressive loss of art's audience. Art has increasingly become the concern of the artist and the bafflement of the public.
It is a mistake for a sculptor or a painter to speak or write very often about his job. It releases tension needed for his work.
When I make art, I think about its ability to connect with others, to bring them into the process.
When that shutter clicks, anything else that can be done afterward is not worth consideration.
Culture is the arts elevated to a set of beliefs.
If a building becomes architecture, then it is art.
Art ought never to be considered except in its relations with its ideal beauty.
I realize that protest paintings are not exactly in vogue, but I've done many.
I was the least Pop of all the Pop artists.
I paint with shapes.
I'm not gonna give the British Government the joy of keeping taxing me. They don't tax art. And all my cars are just a collection of art.
I think of my peace paintings as one long poem, with each painting being a single stanza.
My attitude towards drawing is not necessarily about drawing. It's about making the best kind of image I can make, it's about talking as clearly as I can.
Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things that give value to survival.
It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge.
The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and science.
The art of acceptance is the art of making someone who has just done you a small favor wish that he might have done you a greater one.
Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it everywhere, diagnosing it incorrectly and applying the wrong remedies.

Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece, make friendship a fine art, drink deeply from good books - especially the Bible, build a shelter against a rainy day, give thanks for your blessings and pray for guidance every day.
All the art of living lies in a fine mingling of letting go and holding on.
Love of beauty is taste. The creation of beauty is art.
Those who educate children well are more to be honored than they who produce them; for these only gave them life, those the art of living well.

Even in literature and art, no man who bothers about originality will ever be original: whereas if you simply try to tell the truth (without caring twopence how often it has been told before) you will, nine times out of ten, become original without ever having noticed it.
The art of love is largely the art of persistence.

Sometimes being a friend means mastering the art of timing. There is a time for silence. A time to let go and allow people to hurl themselves into their own destiny. And a time to prepare to pick up the pieces when it's all over.
Be slow to fall into friendship; but when thou art in, continue firm and constant.
Beautiful music is the art of the prophets that can calm the agitations of the soul; it is one of the most magnificent and delightful presents God has given us.

Excellence is an art won by training and habituation. We do not act rightly because we have virtue or excellence, but we rather have those because we have acted rightly. We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act but a habit.
It is through art, and through art only, that we can realise our perfection.
The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
All art is quite useless.
The moment you think you understand a great work of art, it's dead for you.
There's no art to find the mind's construction in the face.
It is only an auctioneer who can equally and impartially admire all schools of art.
What we have to do, what at any rate it is our duty to do, is to revive the old art of Lying.
I wash my hands of those who imagine chattering to be knowledge, silence to be ignorance, and affection to be art.

The hours I spend with you I look upon as sort of a perfumed garden, a dim twilight, and a fountain singing to it. You and you alone make me feel that I am alive. Other men it is said have seen angels, but I have seen thee and thou art enough.
Procrastination is the art of keeping up with yesterday.
Speak the truth, do not yield to anger; give, if thou art asked for little; by these three steps thou wilt go near the gods.

I started to make a study of the art of war and revolution and, whilst abroad, underwent a course in military training. If there was to be guerrilla warfare, I wanted to be able to stand and fight with my people and to share the hazards of war with them.
In general, the art of government consists of taking as much money as possible from one class of citizens to give to another.
A fool's brain digests philosophy into folly, science into superstition, and art into pedantry. Hence University education.

Find a beautiful piece of art. If you fall in love with Van Gogh or Matisse or John Oliver Killens, or if you fall love with the music of Coltrane, the music of Aretha Franklin, or the music of Chopin - find some beautiful art and admire it, and realize that that was created by human beings just like you, no more human, no less.
Leadership is the art of getting someone else to do something you want done because he wants to do it.
The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to overlook.
Next to the Word of God, the noble art of music is the greatest treasure in the world.
Admiration for a quality or an art can be so strong that it deters us from striving to possess it.
For art to exist, for any sort of aesthetic activity to exist, a certain physiological precondition is indispensable: intoxication.
Sleeping is no mean art: for its sake one must stay awake all day.
The art of acting consists in keeping people from coughing.
Art raises its head where creeds relax.
When art dresses in worn-out material it is most easily recognized as art.
The bad gains respect through imitation, the good loses it especially in art.
Homer has taught all other poets the art of telling lies skillfully.
It is Homer who has chiefly taught other poets the art of telling lies skillfully.
Life is the art of drawing without an eraser.
I think in art, but especially in films, people are trying to confirm their own existences.

I do not know what the spirit of a philosopher could more wish to be than a good dancer. For the dance is his ideal, also his fine art, finally also the only kind of piety he knows, his 'divine service.'
The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing.
